name: Park Hyatt Paris - Vendome

reviews.text: Impeccable service especially at breakfast
reviews.title: Glorious stay

reviews.text: Catered to my every need and so close to everything I needed
reviews.title: My best stayed hotel so far

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was fabulous
reviews.title: Amazing Location and Even More Amazing Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And had an amazing fragrance throughout the hotel which is possible to purchase at reception
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel

reviews.text: Will certainly return
reviews.title: Wow wow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything about this hotel is designed to maximize your pleasure and the staff is absolutely superlative. Every employee is genuinely friendly and courteous (without being in the least fawning) and is well-trained to make you feel as if your patronage at the hotel is both desired and appreciated. We were upgraded to a beautiful, deluxe room by the excellent guest services manager, Marie, who took every possible effort to make sure we were not just satisfied, but indeed delighted, with our accommodations. We were also provided with complimentary breakfast in the beautiful restaurant, where the service was superb and the food array was both artistically displayed and delicious. The location was, of course, excellent, at the Place Vendome, which was convenient both to the Opera Metro station and the Roissy bus to the airport. This is an intimate, quiet, and luxurious property and, if you have the Hyatt points, or can otherwise afford it, you will find no cause for disappointment and will revel in the environment.
reviews.title: With Pleasure
My favorite hyatt - simply the best!
reviews.text: I am a diamond member at hyatt and I have stayed at Hyatts around the world. This by far exceeds any other Hyatt. The hotel decor is down to the bath soaps is beyond exceptional. Superior customer service! I highly recommend it! Treat yourself to truely memorable experience!

Stayed for two nights to recoup after business trip to Asia. The property is located close to the exclusive Place Vendome. This is a fancy name for a large square that boasts some really exclusive shops as well as another highend hotel. Makes for great walking and exercising in the neighborhood.
reviews.title: Great Quality, Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property is top of the range for Hyatt in a compact city such as Paris. Rooms were generously sized and the bathrooms functionally well laid out and very spacious.
reviews.title: AMAZING!!!!

reviews.text: Enjoyed a couple of meals in Les Orchidee's located on the lobby level. The restaurant makes up the main vibe of this plush area and all the food my business associate and I enjoyed was of an exceptional standard.
reviews.title: one of the better options, especially for location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'll add my review to the many that already had great things to say about this hotel.
reviews.title: Amazing 2 Night Stay

reviews.text: For us, we stayed for two free nights on the Hyatt visa card. These were suite nights and upon arrival we were upgraded to a Prestige suite (at check in I was a platinum member). The room was ridiculous (a good thing). Full living room with a fireplace, 1.5 bathrooms (one of the toilets was an automated/heated bidet), two walk in closet areas, amazing bathtub/shower. Nespresso machine and evian was also in the room.
reviews.title: Amazing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As our first stay in the hotel, we were offered complimentary breakfast buffet, which was amazing.
reviews.title: Favourite place to stay in Paris

reviews.text: Top notch service, great location....I could go on and on...Love this hotel!
reviews.title: TOP NOTCH Property with TOP NOTCH service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival here on a Tuesday we were checked in and received a very nice room with windows, and a very luxurious one at that! Massive bed, generous bathroom and complimentary Nespresso, chocolates and Evian among the amenities. The spa downstairs was very nice and the service from check-in to our departure was high quality. These people know how to run a hotel. If other Park Hyatts are anything like this one, everyone should get to experience one at least once in a lifetime!
reviews.title: It starts with the smell of Perfume

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Park Hyatt during a 10 day trip to Europe. We chose the hotel because it seemed more modern than the other high-end Paris hotels, and that proved to be accurate. The rooms were large and modern. The location was great, set between Place Vendome and the old Opera. The street is lined with high end retail shops. There is a metro stop at the Opera. You can also walk to the museums from the hotel. The American breakfast, which was included free of charge each day since we are American Express Platinum members, was unbelievable and delivered to our room.
reviews.title: Nice Location and Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The most impressive part of our stay was the Concierge staff. They were able to obtain same-day reservations for some very high end restaurants, like the Jules Verne in the Eiffel Tower and the original Joel Robuchon in St. Germain. They have excellent connections.
reviews.title: Perfect Paris Short-Stay Splurge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took a side trip during the middle of our stay for 3 days, and the hotel allowed us to leave most of our luggage there for our return visit to Paris.
reviews.title: Marvellous time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were only a few negatives during our hotel stay. One was the "business center", which consists of a pathetic printer/scanner machine and a computer terminal. No one seemed to know how to operate it though. The staff ended up having to fax documents from the hotel's own staff fax machine. The other negative was there seemed to be a smoky smell in our room and on our towels when we returned for the last portion of our trip. Also, if your room faces the internal courtyard where people smoke, it tends to waft up, making it difficult to keep the room windows open if it is too warm. But neither of these annoying items was enough to ruin our stay. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Perfection in Paris

reviews.text: My favorite hotel by far, and I have stayed at some winners. We splurged and stayed here the first few nights of our Paris visit (celebrating a wedding anniversary) in mid October. Luxurious and posh, yet truly comforting. It would be tough not to spot a celebrity or rockstar in the mix. We could not fully appreciate what the 'palace' distinction the Park Hyatt Vendome received meant...we do now. Surrounded by incredible art, craftsmanship, and thoughtful amenities, it's the opulence of Paris but up close and personal. Polished mahogany walls and handmade furniture! Our room was spacious and overlooked a courtyard, and the bathroom with its limestone, powerful rainfall shower, and Blaise Mautin products spoiled me forever. One of my favorite room features: the tall french windows (three sets!) which opened to the most peaceful courtyard. No noise whatsoever. I mean the hotel is located on Peace Street, can you beat it? English speaking staff who resemble movie stars did not hurt one bit. We had breakfast at Les Orchidees--and do NOT assume it is a typical hotel buffet! Omg it was incredible. I highly recommend it (again, a bit of a splurge). Lastly, the spa! What a true urban retreat that soothed us after all the walking and sensory overload. We booked an apartment for the rest of our visit, but the Park Hyatt was the best place for us to be pampered for a short stay after the long journey!
reviews.title: No detail goes unnoticed.

description: Recently accepted into the prestigious Palace Hotels Group, Park Hyatt Paris-Vendôme is one of the most visually stunning luxury hotels Paris has to offer. Its striking blend of contemporary architecture and classic design was conceived by renowned designer Ed Tuttle, lending the hotel a sensual, understated elegance that extends throughout - from the lavish Paris hotel rooms and suites to the captivating social areas and impressive meeting venues.
